TopicTitle: When will a 64-bit version of Kerble come out?

Articles.Content: I have windows 8(64bit) running on my system with 16gb of ram. I recently bought Kerble and love the game. But I noticed that its running in 32bit. I didn't give it much thought until I started modding Kerble. I soon ran out of ram when Kerble used about 1.5gb of ram witch is about how much a 32bit game is allocated to use. Kerble running by itself with no mods at 32bit runs perfectly fine,and I don't think we would be having this discussion if there was not a modding community.I have done some research and understand the unity(witch is the game engine the Kerble uses) does not support 64bit builds. I am wondering when there will be an update to Kerble and or Unity allowing builds in 64bit. I am also wondering when Kerble will support multi core CPUs as I have an 8-core processor.

First off, welcome to the forums!

Second, 64-bit support is a commonly requested feature. However, it's been such a common request that it's been placed on the What Not To Suggest list, as are a great many items that are either already scheduled for further development, confirmed not to be on the developers' To-Do lists, or that are otherwise infeasible for whatever reason. I would highly advise familiarizing yourself with this list before making further suggestions.

Have a nice day
